title: OPL 2016 Season - Q&A
body:
http://oce.lolesports.com/sites/default/files/OPL%20logo.png

With All Star closing out the 2015 year it is time we look forward to next year and the OPL 2016 Season, which will be kicking off on January 18th and the first week continuing on the 19th and 20th.

We're around this afternoon to answer any of the questions you might have! We will be releasing more details early in the new year, however today we will answer what you guys are most interested in!

Today we have:
Cpt Stupendous - eSports Manager
Riot Marowi - League Operations
Riot Benji - Broadcast

Send us your questions, and May the Force be with you!

replies.body: What kind of format will be used? Same as last split?

We're making a couple of significant changes to the OPL format for 2016, specifically:
- all regular season matches will be best of three,
- each split will run for ten weeks.

The way this will work is that the league will have two groups (e.g. A and B). Group A plays a double round robin, Group B plays a double round robin, and Group A teams play vs Group B teams in a cross-group single round robin. [EDIT:] All teams are still playing on a single ladder, with standings from 1 through 8.

Effectively, within a split, every team will still play each of the others once, and some twice.

I understand that Group A and Group B have a double round robin among themselves.

What do you mean by a cross-group single round robin? 
Do you mean each member of a group will play a single game vs the teams of the other group?
What is the points system for 2-0, 2-1, 1-2 and 0-2 in the bo3?

I'm concerned about the two groups being split, depending on how the system works for the cross-group round robin. What happens if Group A is evenly matched (all matches are 2-1 or 1-2) but a single team in Group B has gone 0-2 the entire double round robin. Would that team have a chance at worst placing 5th in overall standing?

That seems like a very odd system as conferences tend to promote inequality in terms of scheduling and finals, not to mention there are no Australian sports that cover conference systems, do you think it can become popular in Oceania? Given that a bo3 setup will lower fluke wins and cheese due to having more games to take out a series, why not have it as 7 weeks everyone plays each other once? Doesn't that system fit a really familiar format that the oceanic viewing public are used to?

The OPL format is quite different to a conference; we have a consolidated ladder where the games within and between the groups will be spread across the split, rather than two separate ladders concluding with playoffs between the top from each group.

We considered a 7 week split (where each of the 8 teams plays everyone plays each other once in a best-of-three), but ultimately we decided it was more important to move to a longer season, where the top teams in Oceania can compete on a regular basis for more of the year.
That seems pretty unfair if some teams end up with a death group or something like that?

That's a great point, and we considered how to make this fair to all teams in the league.

The groups have been seeded 1-8 (based on 2015 standings), and then randomised. That is, teams were paired based on seed (1&2, 3&4, 5&6, 7&8) and then the pair was split into either group, determined by coin flip.

The outcome of the draw will be revealed early next year!

With all the roster changes I don't expect last splits standings to be very relevant. I am interested to see how it plays out, might be all fine and dandy. But what will you do if a team does get screwed by groups?

We won't be making any adjustments to a schedule during the split, but the same draw process will occur between each split, so any changes in standings would be reflected then.

In any format where the number of matches don't divide evenly among the teams, there's an element of luck to the draw - some teams will invariably have a tougher draw than others.

I'd be interested to hear your thoughts on the group balance, once it's announced!
How will the Promotion/Demotion system work between splits now that you have two groups?

The groups are solely for scheduling purposes - all teams are still playing on a single ladder, with standings from 1 through 8. The promotion/relegation system will still take the bottom teams from the OPL ladder and pit them against the top teams from the OCS.

I've updated my earlier post to reflect this more clearly - thanks for asking!
How are you aiming to increase fan interaction between the pros and their fans this split?
Out of curiosity, what sort of fan interaction would you like to see between pros and their fans?

I'd love to see video interviews where pros talk about being in the OPL, how their team is going mid split, maybe even throw in some trash talk. Just something that shows the personality of the players so you can really get behind a team.

Fan games, more player based interaction during the OPL broadcast (not just 5 games with analysis and then an abrupt end), maybe Riot can't do much with the personal team being more out there (like NA with social media/streams) but hopefully you can provide encouragement to provide more of fan base to the select teams to allow more serious fans and less laissez-faire fans. Riot might have to impinge and show an example for teams to be more allowing for fans. (I know OCE/OPL is new but I think 2016 will be the magnum opus for OPL)
Smite puts it well when he said:
> Just something that shows the personality of the players so you can really get behind a team.

:D
Thanks for the feedback! I'll look to share your thoughts with the teams.
A lot of teams do plenty of fan games already. You should follow your favorite team on Facebook or Twitter to find out when they host them

Could this be a result not knowing in the case of Dian? 
Abyss, how did you come about following your favourite team on social media?

What date will the schedule be released?

And what will be the casting talent lineup?

We plan on having the full schedule on the website early next year. 

As for casting talent, at this point all I can confirm is the return of both Spawns! (Rusty is the second Spawn for those that do not see the similarity)

WTF two Spawns?! xD

Perfect meme, 5/7.
whyyy {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
Don't you give me that look, Stress. You aren't even from this region! ;) :D :>
We're planning on making a much more detailed release very early in the new year.
Any plans to have an finals/semis or riot events for OPL in NZL?

The Oceanic Pro League belongs to Oceania, not just Sydney or Melbourne and I think it's important for the location of the regions biggest event to reflect that. 

However, finding esports venues is not easy! We're still in the process of scouting and finalising a venue for next year and hope to announce early 2016.
Hey Vector Arena is a pretty great venue!
Christchurch also has got a new venue after the earthquake
Will we see Riot involved with the University Championship in season 6? It was a ton of fun to be involved with this year!
Absolutely! UNSW and UofA have a great rivalry! Will it continue? Will another Uni step up?
Hopefully this time Otago isn't knocked out of the first round by the first place team!
Hopefully UTS makes it through the qualifier this time BibleThump
Need more soraas

For Benji

Is the broadcast team being expanded to help bring the OPL closer to the overseas circuits in terms of production value?

We are expanding both our team and our tech to help improve the quality. We are naturally a smaller region, however that doesn't mean we cannot put on a higher quality production of the show. I don't want to talk about the actual changes yet as I don't want to set super high expectations, however our goal for the show is to continue to improve the quality over the entire year. 

I feel that this year we definitely improved the show week to week, and we will continue to do that moving forwards.
Live audience, when? :D

This is of course something we're all passionate about! However, we're not ready for it yet. Flying in players, building a studio, etc is all extremely resource intensive and there are areas it makes sense to focus on first.
Why the change of format, what made you go from bo1 to bo3 and also, why a split group format?

We felt that BO1 didn't provide either the best fan/viewer experience or the best competitive experience for players and teams.

We also wanted to expand the regular season out from 7 weeks, but at the moment there isn't space to go up to 14 weeks.  With 10 weeks of regular play we think this is best solution.
Any plans to recognise coaches officially? Much like NA/EU have done
We recognised coaches towards the end of the 2015 season.
To Benji - Any chance we can get a camera for each player during OPL next season? Currently it's just one camera per team!

We ran player cams at the OPL Final, and would love to bring them to our studio at some point. We don't have plans on doing them right now (We are definitely making some production improvements next year) however that doesn't mean we won't add them at some point.
Can you give us any teasers on the production improvements?

I prefer to leave them as pleasant surprises when they hit. You should notice them though! 

Hoping to have them in place for the start of the season, however time is quite short, and there is lots of work to do!

To Cpt Stupendous,

Just wondering if there will be any changes to the qualification/relegation process for 2016? 

Thanks

Hi Crunch, I love your cereal. 

We're making some changes to the pipeline which we'll announce next year but I can say that the OOL and OCS will still exist and will be the main pipeline into the OPL.
When we will see the start of the Oceanic Open Ladder season or system? Will it be the same as last seasons, or is something new being done?
